subject: Law
title: International Trade Sanctions
description: A quick, practical guide to International Trade Sanctions.

hook.text: Russia invaded Ukraine. Within days, its banks were cut off and assets frozen. Sanctions hit without a single bullet.

buildup.text: Sanctions are economic penalties imposed by states or international bodies to pressure a target into changing behavior.

discovery.text: Types include trade embargoes, asset freezes, travel bans, and exclusion from financial systems like SWIFT.

twist.text: Sanctions often hurt ordinary citizens more than leaders. Food and medicine shortages are common side effects.

climax.text: Their effectiveness is debated. Cuba has been sanctioned for decades with limited political change.

punchline.text: Sanctions are war by other means. Their collateral damage is real.

quiz.question: What is a common criticism of international sanctions?
options: They often harm ordinary citizens more than leaders
